title: 105_hr2507
content: The Act may be cited as the "ATM Public Safety and Crime Control Act" and requires enhanced security measures at depository institutions. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, based on recommendations from the FBI Director. This includes maintaining quality surveillance cameras for criminal prosecution purposes. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, based on FBI Director recommendations. Insured credit unions must maintain quality surveillance cameras as per regulations. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for depository institutions to provide quality surveillance cameras for effective evidence in criminal prosecutions. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for depository institutions to provide quality surveillance cameras for effective evidence in criminal prosecutions. SEC. 3. STUDY AND TECHNICAL RECOMMENDATIONS BY FBI. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for surveillance equipment to reduce crimes at financial institutions. The Director of the FBI will review security standards and consult with the Attorney General for effective crime prevention measures. The Director of the FBI will consult with the Attorney General to address security issues at financial institutions hindering prosecutions under criminal provisions. Recommendations for security standards will be made to federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 and section 205(e) of the Federal Credit Union Act require the Director of the FBI to submit security recommendations to the Judiciary Committees of the House of Representatives and the Senate. A clerical amendment is made to the United States Code. The Federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board must finalize regulations based on FBI recommendations within 6 months. Depository institutions and credit unions must comply with these regulations within 6 months of publication. Amendments to definitions are also included. Amendments to definitions under the Bank Protection Act of 1968 include defining 'depository institution' and 'Federal supervisory agency' in alignment with the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
